Back in 2014 I bought my first Raspberry Pi. At first it was only meant for tinkering. Homelab-ing, though, is like opening a bag of chips: once you start, you won’t be able to stop ðŸ˜….
However Raspberry Pies aren’t meant for production â€“Â I often found the RPi had destroyed the SD card, not to mention that back then they were slow. So I kept my RPi for tinkering and ordered an Ubuntu droplet on DigitalOcean (use this link to get $100 in credit ðŸ¤‘) for my production side projects and self-hosted apps.
 WIP Needs?:
 Storage Compute power Doesn’t break as often as rpi Others?  My first production-grade server HPE Microserver Gen8 + 2 x 4Tb HDDs on a RAID1 setup.
Best thing of my homelab is that it was not planned & has evolved ==> lots of learning
 Used to run a mail server + updated the Linux kernel ==> the mail server stopped running
Lessons learnt * Test on a staging env before updating prod * Don't run your own mail server
